context: The Finnish word 'asia' is a versatile noun that can mean matter, issue, affair, concern, business, subject, case or thing. It can also refer to an errand. The word has many different forms depending on the grammatical context, as shown in the declension table provided. For example, 'asioilla' means 'running errands'.  The genitive form 'asian' is used to indicate possession ('the matter of').
